meanings.definition: Not composed of matter; having no physical existence.
meanings.sent1: The ghostly figure was believed to be incorporeal, as it passed through walls effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The idea of a spirit being incorporeal is a common belief in many cultures.
meanings.sent3: The scientist joked that the elusive unicorn must be incorporeal, explaining why it has never been captured.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him felt incorporeal, like a fleeting dream that she couldn't hold onto.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time is incorporeal, yet it shapes our perception of reality in profound ways.

meanings.definition: Lacking a physical body or form.
meanings.sent1: The genie in the bottle was depicted as an incorporeal being, granting wishes with magic.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly apparition appeared incorporeal, floating eerily in the abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking cat seemed incorporeal, but it was just a clever illusion.
meanings.sent4: Her voice on the phone sounded incorporeal, distant and ethereal.
meanings.sent5: The shadow cast by the tree looked incorporeal, like a fleeting silhouette in the moonlight.
